text: I want to take a moment to recognize every spouse who has endured losing their partner in service to our nation. Our country will forever admire your strength and sacrifice. https://t.co/kzM9HIvCzg

I encourage all of our small businesses who are struggling to make ends meet due to the coronavirus pandemic to apply for assistance made available by the CARES Act. Learn about your options and apply at:  https://t.co/oA7PMCwEVr https://t.co/qKXNPel7BT
Tax rebates are on the way thanks to the CARES Act. Learn more about how coronavirus economic relief payments to individuals will work at: https://t.co/HjKf4N3yIH
The CARES Act defers federal student loan and interest payments for 6 months and provides aid for certain current students effected by the coronavirus. (3/3)

The CARES Act provides incentives for your company to keep you on payroll during this crisis. If you are laid off, unemployment benefits have been strengthened to help you cover bills for the time being. (2/3)

The CARES Act provides a one-time payment in the form of a tax rebate for middle- and low-income individuals, which should be received within weeks. This DOES include Social Security recipients. (1/3)

This isn't a time for politics - at all. We need to pass a bill today. 
 
Speaker Pelosi - for the good of the country, stop playing politics with a national crisis. (3/3)

We need a bill now to ensure American families have the assistance they need to get through this uncertain time. Instead, Speaker Pelosi & House Democrats are conditioning assistance to American families and businesses to enact liberal priorities like the Green New Deal. (2/3)

The measures required to defeat this virus are unlike anything we've ever experienced. Right now, people are scared, confused and frustrated as our economy comes to a standstill and widespread job losses are occurring. (1/3)
